pr_title: Initial work to support component plugin with integ test

timeline.bodyText:
Recommendation generated by Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer. Leave feedback on this recommendation by replying to the comment or by reacting to the comment using emoji.
Problem
This line of code contains a resource that might not be closed properly. Resource leaks can cause your system to slow down or crash.
Fix
Consider closing the following resource: cl. The resource is referenced in statements at the following line: 96. The resource is returned at line: 99. There are other execution paths that don't close the resource or return it, for example, when FastClasspathScanner constructor throws an exception. To prevent this resource leak, close cl along these other paths before you exit this method.
More info
View resource management guidelines at oracle.com (external link).
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: The class loader cannot be closed because we need to continue loading classes from it after this method exits. It cannot even be closed after we initialize the service class because we may need more classes from the loaded jar dynamically.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: So every in jvm component has to be built as plugin.jar? Why can't we use the component name to infer the jar name instead of using hardcoded plugin.jar?
timeline.author: fengwang666

replies.bodyText: Yes, that's correct. In my proof of concept I had added a field to specify the jar name, but I decided against that because it requires a recipe change. I think that it is reasonable to force the artifact to be named plugin.jar.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Why can't we just infer the jar name from the component name? It seems hacky to require every component building plugin.jar.
replies.author: fengwang666

timeline.bodyText: nit: ident seems an odd abbreviation. Maybe just id or pkgId?
timeline.author: fengwang666

timeline.bodyText:
Extract plugin to a constant?
Also this whole if..else block is getting a bit difficult to read. Maybe add some comments or refactor to private methods with more clear name?
timeline.author: fengwang666
fengwang666

replies.bodyText: The purpose is so that the version which is in the recipe file will overwrite this. This is just in case the version in the annotation isn't updated; but we know that the recipe will have the proper version because cloud won't allow it otherwise.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: This pretty much allows everyone create a plugin jar and run it in evergreen kernel jvm.
timeline.author: fengwang666

replies.bodyText: Yes it does. I won't change anything in this PR to keep it smaller, but we can add more security around this. I think the idea was going to be to add code signing, right? What else do you think should be added for security other than code signing?
replies.author: MikeDombo
fengwang666

replies.bodyText: Code signing would work by checking the signature against a set of trusted CAs. In our kernel only the Evergreen root CA would be trusted by default.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText:
A list could work, but I'd prefer to not have a list so that it is actually extensible. Anupam suggested maybe going by the publisher, so if it is "AWS", then it can be trusted.
Permissions won't help at all since these components are coming from the cloud and not the disk
replies.author: MikeDombo
